author: jgm
content: `--port` is somewhat generic though, when you have P2P, metrics, HTTP API, perhaps gRPC API all of which have separate ports.

author: ajsutton
content: I'm not at all a fan of trying to standardise CLI options. There has to be a point where clients are allowed to actually differ. Teku has a style guide for it's CLI options that we follow and leads us to use `--p2p-port`  so it fits in with all the other p2p related options that start with `--p2p` (and as jgm said to differentiate from the rest api port and so on).  And unless we're going to standardise every CLI option tools will have to be able to use different CLI options for each client for a whole bunch of things anyway.
